meanings.definition: The act of deserting or abandoning someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The soldier's desertion from his post was a serious offense.
meanings.sent2: The town's desertion during the winter months was noticeable.
meanings.sent3: The cat's desertion of its favorite toy led to a comical chase around the house.
meanings.sent4: The desertion of the old factory symbolized the decline of the once-thriving industry.
meanings.sent5: The sudden desertion of the playground by the children left it eerily quiet.

meanings.definition: The state of being deserted or abandoned.
meanings.sent1: The desertion of the house gave it a lonely feel.
meanings.sent2: The desertion of the park at night was eerie.
meanings.sent3: The desertion of the ice cream shop on a hot day was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The desertion of the shipwreck on the shore was a haunting sight.
meanings.sent5: The desertion of the classroom after the bell rang was swift.
